subject: Re: Automatic JUnit Tests generators you know
msgSnippet: ... Ciao Alberto, Check out: http://www.junitfactory.com It s something we are experimenting with at AgitarLabs. It s free and a lot of the technology behind
messageBody:
--- In junit@yahoogroups.com, Alberto Bacchelli <sback@...> wrote:
>
> Hi,
>
> I would like to know which automatic JUnit test generators you know.
>
> My purpose is to compare them [results,benefits,lacks] against
> traditional hand-writted Junit tests, in a legacy software environment
> without others JUnit tests written before.
>
> Currently I know only
> Eclat: http://groups.csail.mit.edu/pag/eclat/
> Randoop: http://people.csail.mit.edu/cpacheco/randoop/0.1/doc/
>
> Thank you in advance,
>
> Sback
>
> PS Actually it could be better if the suggested generators are free to
> use at least for an academic research
>

Ciao Alberto,

Check out: http://www.junitfactory.com


It's something we are experimenting with at AgitarLabs. It's free and
a lot of the technology behind it was inspired by the research done at
MIT by the people you mention in some of the other links (Dr. Mike
Ernst and his students at MIT's CSAIL). I am very interested in your
research in applying automated test generation to legacy code. It's a
very tough problem because a lot of legacy code was not written with
testability in mind (manual or automated) and something I am also
working on (another thing we have in common besides our first name :-)).


Alberto
